input:

46:59 Caption: It wasn't the most inspiring 45 minutes that you'll see this week. Let's hope that the second period will be more exciting. Neither side has gained the upper hand as yet. Both sides are using combination football to try and gain the upper hand.

Second Half:

46:44 Caption: The resulting corner from Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) only finds one of the defenders, who heads it out of danger.
48:37 Caption: Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) gets on the end of a pass and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but it's blocked by one of the defending players.
49:11 Caption: David Silva (Manchester City) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
50:52 Caption: There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
50:59 Caption: What a thrilling encounter, there was plenty of goal mouth action. The hosts were largely in control of the game today. Short passing and possession was the style of the home side, while the visiting side tried to hit their opposition on the break.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
A highly anticipated encounter unfolded as Manchester City took on Tottenham Hotspur at the Etihad Stadium, with both teams eager to clinch a crucial victory. The match kicked off in earnest with Tottenham getting the proceedings underway. Right from the start, it was clear both teams were prepared for an intense duel, aiming to gain the upper hand.

In the early exchanges, the ball found itself out of play numerous times and Tottenham quickly assumed a throw-in. Manchester City were full of energy, but their enthusiasm got the better of them early on as they committed a foul in the second minute. Tottenham, eager to capitalize on this, attempted a direct free-kick which ended up with a shot off-target, failing to trouble Joe Hart.

The first few minutes saw Manchester City struggling slightly with their discipline as they gave away a free-kick again for another foul. Tottenham's attacking force began to show signs of life, particularly with short passes intent on breaching City's lines. Heung-Min Son found himself flagged for offside after straying too early past City's defensive line, missing an opportunity to bear down on goal.

Tottenham's Kyle Walker endeavored to spark Tottenham's attack, but his passes failed to connect accurately with his teammates. Manchester City's drive was evident as they worked cohesively with rapid passes and ball possession. Yet, their ardor again led to frequent fouls, disrupting their own rhythm. Fernando of Manchester City earned a whistle for a hard tackle on an opponent.

Tottenham’s Christian Eriksen took a shot on target, adding to the sense of urgency for both sides to break the deadlock. However, the stalemate persisted. Minutes later, Eriksen again demonstrated his ability with another long-range shot which required Joe Hart’s skill to save. Despite the occasional clear efforts, both teams often settled back into a flow of passes, probing for weaknesses.

City’s David Silva particularly stood out, deftly maneuvering past opponents but was halted by fouls and passionate defending by Tottenham. One such passage led to a corner kick for City. Sergio Aguero struck well but missed the target as the ball sailed over the bar, contributing to the mounting anticipation in the stadium.

As the game proceeded, Manchester City displayed their signature passing game, meticulously weaving through Tottenham's midfield. They won several free-kicks and contended with Tottenham's tight defense. The same could be seen when Spurs’ Eric Dier launched efforts from long range, yet without significant results to alter the score.

With half-time approaching, Tottenham's Eric Dier was shown a yellow card following rash challenges, leading to Manchester City being awarded another free-kick, albeit not capitalized upon. Both teams seemed to save their energy, briefly holding back from risky plays as the whistle for halftime blew.

The first half review painted a picture of a balanced contest, devoid of goals but brimming with potential. Both teams exhibited flashes of brilliance with foiled efforts and tactical fouls being noted across the field. The fans, eagerly anticipating the second half, experienced a match still rife with tension and possibility.

The second half kicked off with Manchester City determined to seize the moment. However, their vigor crossed the line quickly as Vincent Kompany was booked with a yellow card for a tough tackle. With both teams pushing forward, the breakthrough moment surprisingly came courtesy of a foul leading to a penalty for Tottenham after Raheem Sterling handled the ball within the box. Tottenham's Harry Kane stepped up for the penalty, coolly sending Joe Hart the wrong way to put Spurs ahead early in the second half.

Manchester City did not waver in their resolve and immediately applied pressure. They relentlessly crowded Tottenham’s goal with a series of attacks right from the penalty, intent on equalizing as soon as possible. Their efforts saw Fernandinho narrowly miss scoring with a towering header from a corner, sending the ball just above the crossbar. A free-kick moment saw Yaya Toure striking the ball from a promising position, but it disappointingly bounced off the crossbar; luck was not on City's side.

Around the mid-point of the second half, City finally had their persistence pay off. Kelechi Iheanacho found the back of the net, resulting from an inspired cross by Gael Clichy. Iheanacho exhibited great control and composure to slot in the equalizer, igniting the City faithful and marking the scoreboard 1:1.

Momentum seemed to sway back in Manchester City’s favor. They continued to dominate possession and pressed high up the pitch, resulting in multiple efforts on target, albeit saved or thrust away by Tottenham's sturdy defense led by Hugo Lloris. Substitutions also became a strategic element with Manuel Pellegrini introducing fresh legs and approaches to maintain and build their assault.

However, Tottenham, not outshined, struck back as soon as Manchester City’s rhythm felt unbreachable. An astutely crafted attack saw Christian Eriksen set free in the area by a serenity pass from substitute Erik Lamela. Eriksen's exquisite finish into the bottom right corner was a testament to Tottenham's resilient counterattacks, thrusting them ahead once more against the run of play. The goal stood at 2:1 for Tottenham with limited time left.

The latter minutes of the match saw fervent action as Manchester City threw everything forward to salvage a point from the game. Tactful passing and skilful maneuvers characterized their play but, despite multiple shots and last-minute corners, Tottenham’s defense proved impenetrable. City attempted high crosses and through-balls, but the polished defending from Tottenham maintained their lead.

Late substitutions by both teams further added fresh dynamics, but it was Tottenham's defensive resilience and tactical awareness that carried them through to the end. A few more last-ditch efforts from City, such as Sterling’s blocked shot and Silva’s last-gasp attempt, all fell short. The final whistle came after an exasperating series of attacks from the home side, confirming a hard-earned victory for Tottenham.

The game concluded with Tottenham victorious over Manchester City by a score of 2:1. It was a riveting clash marked by goals from Harry Kane and Christian Eriksen for Spurs, and a brief glimmer of hope for City through Kelechi Iheanacho. Despite dominant possession and consistent pressure, Manchester City could not translate efforts into more goals. Tottenham’s resiliency and clinical finish on the counter made the difference. 

This contest showcased footballing tenacity, strategic brilliance, and moments of individual heroism, contributing to a memorable match that will be talked about by fans and analysts alike for time to come. The win for Tottenham speaks volumes about their capacity to endure pressure and execute game-changing plays at critical junctures. For Manchester City, it was a lesson in the thin margins of football, where dominance doesn't always equate to victory, reminding them of the unyielding demands of the Premier League.
